unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: $t$-distribution vs. Normal Distribution
question_text: In what way is the $t$ -distribution different from the standard normal distribution?

choices.text: There are many t t -distributions based on the number of degrees of freedom, but only one standard normal distribution.
The t t -distribution cannot be used to determine if an observed statistic is unusual, but the standard normal distribution can be used in this way.
The area under the curve of the t t -distribution changes as the number of degrees of freedom changes.  The area under the standard normal curve is always 1 1 .
The t t -distribution is not useful in constructing confidence intervals.
The t t -distribution is not useful in conducting hypothesis tests.
